I hereby give you a written deed of gift stating that you will be my sole husband and that, due to my natural affection, affection, love and respect for you, you will not have any support, and I have a firm resolve to provide you with a support that will be beneficial to you. Therefore, I have given you the immovable property valued at Rs. 3,55,000 (literally three lakhs and fifty five thousand rupees) as per the schedule below, which I have in my possession, as a gift without any consideration, and I have taken possession of the said property this day. All the rights and interests I have had over this property until now shall belong to you, me, my sisters and brothers, their heirs or any other person. As of this date, you shall transfer the Scheduled Assets in your name to the Revenue and Panchayat and Electricity City Accounts and retain the Scheduled Assets in your possession with all rights, i.e. donation, ownership, exchange, sale, lease, enjoyment, mortgage, etc., with all rights and liabilities, free and clear. This is a written and signed donation deed by me.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 899 of 2026 dated 23-Jan-2026, executed by P Archana in favour of her Husband Ravi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 73.33 Sq.Yds., bearing house number 2-84, Assessment No. 576, comprised in survey number 128, situated in Santebidanur Village and Gram Panchayat, Hindupuram Mandal, within the District of Sri Satya Sai, registered at sub-registrar office Hindupur is bounded as follows: North by: House Of Sanjivarayappa South by: House Of Hanumanthappa East by: Panchayathi Road West by: House Of Kaavelappa

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note : It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
